title: "Squeegee" Attack Stops Downtown Traffic
body: BALTIMORE (WBFF) - A stand-off between squeegee workers and a motorist brings traffic to a standstill.It happened at the intersection of Martin Luther King Boulevard and Washington Boulevard Friday afternoon.A West Baltimore woman and her two children were stopped at the red light when, she says, the workers attacked her vehicle.After calling 9-1-1, an officer arrived on the scene as the threats grew."One of the guys said, 'I'll go get a gun,'"  said Latonya.RELATED |The incident stopped traffic on the busy MLK Blvd  for 15 minutes as the officer defused the argument; the victim filed no charges."I fear for my life right now, and I can't go to that intersection anymore. I pay taxes and should be able to drive anywhere in Baltimore," said the motorist.
